definition:
The *Copeland-Erdős constant* is the concatenation of “0.” with the base
10 representations of the prime numbers in order. Its value is
approximately 0.235711131719232931374143... listed in A033308 of
Sloane’s OEIS.

The larger Smarandache-wellin numbers approximate the value of this
constant multiplied by the appropriate power of 10.

Its continued fraction is

$0 + \frac{1}{4 + \frac{1}{4 + \frac{1}{8+\,\cdots}}}$

and is listed in A030168 of the OEIS.

In base 10, this is a normal number, a fact proven by A.H. Copeland and
Paul Erdős in 1946 (hence the name of the constant).
